page.title: 11Housing in Lullington
page.content: The standard of housing in Lullington village is very high. Most of the 48 dwellings are over 50 years old & are owner occupied. There is an even balance between detached & semi- detached premises. Several of the original cottages have been renovated. Lullington Hall stables and the blacksmiths shop have been converted to provide two additional homes. There are 6 council houses on the eastern side of the village although other rented accomodation is limited. 5 old peoples bungalows were built on land previousy occupied by a terrace. More recent development has been restricted to infilling and only 1 new detached house has been added in the last 15 years. Indeed, Lullington was designated a Conservation Area in 1977. It has won Derbyshire's best kept village award several times.
